answerText: Iphigenia in Tauris[10] In this play featuring a debate between Helen and Hecuba, the Greek herald Talthybius announces the fates of the title characters and bathes the body of Astyanax in the Scamander River.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 12 | 8 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, Orestes and Pylades are nearly sacrificed before they are recognized. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play in which the title character helps Orestes steal a statue from a temple of Artemis in order to free himself from the Furies.
